definitions.text: a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
examples: he showed signs of strain
they welcomed the signs of spring

definitions.text: a public display of a message
examples: he posted signs in all the shop windows

definitions.text: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
examples: signals from the boat suddenly stopped

definitions.text: structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted
examples: the highway was lined with signboards

definitions.text: (astrology) one of 12 equal areas into which the zodiac is divided
(medicine) any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease
examples: there were no signs of asphyxiation

definitions.text: having an indicated pole (as the distinction between positive and negative electric charges)
examples: he got the polarity of the battery reversed
charges of opposite sign

definitions.text: an event that is experienced as indicating important things to come
examples: he hoped it was an augury
it was a sign from God

definitions.text: a gesture that is part of a sign language
a fundamental linguistic unit linking a signifier to that which is signified; --de Saussure
examples: The bond between the signifier and the signified is arbitrary

definitions.text: a character indicating a relation between quantities
examples: don't forget the minus sign

definitions.text: mark with one's signature; write one's name (on)
examples: She signed the letter and sent it off
Please sign here

definitions.text: approve and express assent, responsibility, or obligation
examples: All parties ratified the peace treaty
Have you signed your contract yet?

definitions.text: be engaged by a written agreement
examples: He signed to play the casino on Dec. 18
The soprano signed to sing the new opera

definitions.text: engage by written agreement
examples: They signed two new pitchers for the next season

definitions.text: communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
examples: He signed his disapproval with a dismissive hand gesture
The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu

definitions.text: place signs, as along a road
examples: sign an intersection
This road has been signed

definitions.text: communicate in sign language
examples: I don't know how to sign, so I could not communicate with my deaf cousin

definitions.text: make the sign of the cross over someone in order to call on God for protection; consecrate
used of the language of the deaf
